description: This is a great local sports bar. I'm new to the area and I feel very welcome here. Lots of TV's and friendly staff
author: Jim G.

description:
Came here Saturday morning to watch the Premier League fixtures. I  was surprised to only see a handful of people viewing the games. From talking to the regulars here, it seems like they attract more of a crowd for Giants/ Warriors games as compared to soccer. The servers were nice and the beer was the standard fare of Guinness/Anchor/Sierra Nevada...

I would recommend this bar if you`re planning to head to Golden Gate Park since its close and in case Kezar gets crowded.
author: Pranav B.

description: I wouldn't use the words inviting or friendly to describe the staff. And the place is your standard sports dive with average beers a drink specials. Foosball and pool table are nice additions.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Not my choice. A friend , who also so happens to be a devout fan of the church of Kevin Durant, asked to meet up here to watch game three. 

I always remembered this place as being wratch....but it was far nasty than my last visit.

I guess after a few pops it will look just fine, but I am not a fan of this place.

Too many other places in the neighborhood to drink and enjoy the surroundings.
author: David G.

description:
Came here last Saturday night after trying to get away from the crowd at 3910 because we were convinced by the friendly security guard in front. Pretty empty and spacious bar with a lower level and a slightly higher level with a pool table, two dart boards and a broken fooseball. Normally I love going to these types of bars with activities like pool and dart boards but the bartender really needs some changing. My boyfriend exchanged 3 dollar bills for quarters but when we walked to the pool table, he realized that the bartender only gave him $2 worth of quarters so he went back to the bar to let her know. She gave attitude and proceeded to open the cash register, ruffled the dollar bills and said she was pretty sure he only gave 2 dollars. Although she ended up giving that dollar worth of quarters back, the attitude was unnecessary. Service does mean a lot.. especially at such an empty bar like that on a Saturday night. I probably will not be coming back.

I can see so much potential at this bar, but unfortunately we didn't have such a great experience here. 

PS This bar should also consider getting more darts since there's only enough darts for one of the two dart boards at the bar.
author: Amy L.

description: This was probably one of the most accommodating bars I've been to. We were in San Francisco and needed to watch the Golden Knights play off game and not only did they turn the TVs to the game, they also put the sound on. Considering this was a San Jose Sharks bar, that was absolutely amazing. Because of that, we all went back to watch another game there 2 days later. Both times we were there, every bartender was so nice to us and it kinda made us feel like we were at our own local bar. They also let us bring food in, since they don't serve food. That was a HUUUUGE PLUS!!! Thanks staff!!
author: Erin B.

description:
Came to the Abbey because they advertised on their website that they were showing a boxing match with NO cover charge.  When I got to the bar, the owner tried to charge me a cover.  I explained that their website says "No Cover" for the boxing match.  I went onto the website on my phone and showed him that is states "No Cover" charge.  The owner shrugged his shoulders and said there are mistakes on the website and continued to charge me for entry.

Lesson Learned:

I will never go or recommend anyone else to go to the Abbey

The Abbey is a business that does not honor their own statements 

The Abbey uses false advertising to get people to come to the bar
author: Sultan E.

description:
Came here around 11:30pm and the place looked trashed. Not sure if there was only one guy working, but the upstairs area was a mess. Glasses and trash at every table, so there wasn't  really anywhere to sit upstairs. 

Other than that, it's a chill bar. They had an open mic or maybe it was just some locals performing, idk, but it was pretty cool.

It was dope cause they had $7 Irish Flu Shots and if you know me, I love Jamey! A couple of those and you'll be on a great level.
author: June F.

description: Love to watch EPL here. Bar tenders and people are always super friendly and there's plenty of space!
author: Monica L.

description:
They have EPL, La Liga, and Champions League games on! What more can you ask for.

The place doesn't smell like a bar.. which is a relief at 7am while watching Man United beat Liverpool :P
author: Taylor H.

description:
As a huge boxing fan I love this place!

I was here for a few ppv fights recently and this place was packed,  it took me a while to actually find a place that buys ppv boxing fights, however now that I found it I know where to come.

Sure when you order a drink you may have to speak up a few times, or you may order beer and get wine instead, however this is one of the few places that actual boxing fans come out and love to have a casual  conversation.

Last time I was here I found out that they also stream UEFA games, which makes this place even more awesome :)  I will be coming here a lot more than I expected.

All in all this place has a great vibe, if you're into soccer and/or boxing (or mma) this place is a hoot, they do have a cover charge for ppv (pay per view) events ranging from $15-20
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I only write about my experience here as I watched a UFC PPV here pretty recently. There's a small cover charge, but that's to be expected for any establishment putting a PPV up. Literally everywhere you turn there's either a TV or a projection screen, so can't complain about being in a crappy spot. It does get pretty packed though, but it comes with the territory I suppose. Plus the best part is that because they don't serve food, you can bring in your own food as well!
author: Alexander Y.

description:
go for jose! he's an awesome fella even though he only bartends thursdays and sundays he's at the door frequently and seriously made my night. jose thank god for you! 

but besides him still a chill bar with good vibes! much love
author: Cecilia G.

description:
The abbey really is the cats pyjamas. Best spot in the city to watch the famous Glasgow Celtic - they show all the games live, unlike some other questionable establishments in the  city that show recorded games after the fact. 

As Scotsman living in the bay area this tavern is a wee haven, the walls are adorned with fine Celtic imagery and the jukebox has quality rebel tunes.

Fine banter from the staff and stella on tap, what more can yee ask for?

UP THE RA
HAIL HAIL
author: Justin B.

description:
Came here on NYE to celebrate. The place was a cool chill bar. Environment was friendly. The crowd we met was nice.

There was a pool table & foosball table, tv's all around. It was nice and clean.

Can't say much about the drinks or staff since I didn't order anything. Not sure about the prices either.
author: Yee W.

description: A Seahawks bar in SF! It was so nice to feel the camaraderie of the Seahawks fans! The bartender was great super chill and the bar had good drink specials! Will definitely be back for more games!
author: Megan E.

description: Just hosted my fiancée 30th here. The owner Dermot could not have been more accommodating with my amateur planning skills. The bar staff were great and the bathrooms are the cleanest I've seen in a neighborhood bar.  Loads of my friends who had never been loved it. Great sports bar too. Check it out
author: Lisa K.

description:
Local bar conveniently located on Geary. I must be really wanting a drink because all I can think about is reviewing bars. Anyways, Abbey Tavern is a really chill place to hang to catch up with some friends. I especially like Thursday night! They have a great DJ playing some music from the 90s~. Yes!! Everything gets a plus one when they have good music playing. It sucks it's only on Thursday night... I think I went on a Saturday night and they had a local band. It's great they support their locals!

Speaking of which. They hang a lot of sports banners. Mostly bay area, you know. Represent. It's actually pretty cool to look at all the ones they have. Plus they always play the games on their TVs. So great place to grab a drink and watch a game. 

Make sure you have your ID ready as you walk in the door. They always have someone checking as you walk in. They have I think a $15 minimum for cards. So make sure you have some cash unless you're gonna spend more than that. Their drinks are pretty reasonable price. And they got weekly/monthly specials on certain beers. So check it out. 

They have two pool tables and booths as you walk further back. Bar stools as you initially walk in. 

I'll be sure to drop by Abbey Tavern if I'm ever out for drinks in the area. (:
author: Joan T.

description:
My UFC hot spot- love coming here to watch fights! Drinks are cheap, crowd is friendly, TVs are everywhere and the bartenders are awesome. I'm usually one of a small handful of girls so heads up ladies- the guy/girl ratio here is totally in your favor!

They don't serve food, but allow you to bring it in if you want. (Quick tip: Bella's Pizza 2 doors down) Bathrooms are clean and I've never had to wait in line.
author: Vicky J.

description:
Hands down the best (and so far the only) Boxing Bar in San Francisco. If you are a fight fan, this is the place to catch the next Mayweather, Manny , Canelo Alvarez, GGG, Kovalev, Abner Mares and many more HBO (regular and PPV) and Showtime PPV fights. They show all the fights on several TVs in the bar and also project it on a HUGE screen in the front.

Whereas at other Bars (Jillians, Rumors) you will likely meet the casual fan who thinks that only Manny Pacquiao and Floyd Mayweather box and also get giddy matching up a lightweight with a light-heavyweight fantasy fight, most partrons of this Bar on Fight Night are very knowledgeable about Boxing, and you will get called out if you don't have your facts straight! This makes for fun conversations and a fun night watching boxing, where you learn something new about the sport (if you can even call it that) everytime you go there.

Cover is usually 20$ on Fight nights, and people complaining about this charge need to realize that PPV Broadcast Networks charge Commercial establishments like this upwards of $2000 minimum to telivise the fights. So the Bar isn't making any money on the cover, because it would require like 100 partrons to show up just to break even.

The Bar is a little "dive-y" and the don't have food, but they let you bring your own, which really works out if you have food allergies or like to watch games or fights munching on your favorite snack or food. I take samosas with me to watch the fights.

Besides boxing, they also show football (American & European) and UFC / MMA, and Baseball.
author: Shiva K.

description:
Came here on St. Patrick's Day [really bad idea, in hindsight] and was nearly crushed by the hoards of Marina / Nob Hill / North Beach bros who decided to slum it out in the Richmond in the sake of getting bloody wasted. 

My female friend and I didn't even bother braving the crush to get to the bar so we ventured outside, and her boyfriend found us and brought us vodka Red Bulls outside which we managed to kill without the nearby cops seeing us.

Maybe on a non-drunk kids holiday? Perhaps.
author: Stephani C.

description:
3.5 stars - came in because Timmy was pitching and we did not have time to make it home to watch the game. 

There was a large group there for some celebration - having a good time, with boxes of pizzas from nearby and a few dogs on leash.  

We grabbed two seats at the corner with direct view of one of the many tvs.  Bartenders were Irish and nice.  Drafts were served in cold glasses from the fridge.  Best part of the visit - Timmy pitched a great game and the Giants won!

On a Saturday night, they got quite crowded with groups coming in.
author: Gloria H.

description: Great neighborhood bar.  I recently walked in randomly during the day by myself (I had been there a few times with other people) and sat down to have a drink.  The bartender was super friendly, and I just started chatting with him and some of the customers sitting next to me.  Everyone was very chill, which is exactly the type of atmosphere I enjoy- friendly, welcoming, and fun.  Another cool thing- they show PPV Fights! Bonus.
author: Ashley T.

description: The worst. Rowdy, loud, rude, crowds of drunk smokers outside. And a terrible neighbor.
author: Barbs J.

description:
Thirsty Thursdays + College Night = HELLA CRACKIN'

I'm OLD and I've been out of college for quite some time now; 6 years to be exact. My friends told me Abbey Tavern is normally crackin' on Thursdays and apparently so because our 11 PM curfew (because we're old and have adult responsibilities) turned into a 3 AM curfew. Talk about cracked out Fridays at work. But anyhow...

Last night, 9.1.11, we came to Abbey's Tavern at around 10:15 PM and there was a small line out the door but after our ID's were checked, we were quickly ushered in. As I walked in I thought to myself, "F*ck, what did I get myself into?" The crowd looked like they just changed out of their Huggies to come to Abbey's. Long behold, I see a poster, "College Night on Thursdays". Umm, I guess it's a good thing I have the Asian genes? *sigh*

B A R
*The bar is super crowded and it's very difficult to get a drink because there's people sitting down/stools in the way. 
*Expect to push and shove your way to the bar. 
*Bartenders are friendly, fast and efficient though.
*CC's are accepted. 

D R I N K S
*DIRT CHEAP & STRONG! 
*On Tuesdays and Thursdays, beer is $1 and pitchers are $6. 
*Cocktails and shots were $4-$5 (I ordered 3 Jager Bombs, Rum & Coke and a Hendrick's Tonic for ONLY $20!) 

M U S I C
*Live DJ
*The DJ last night was AWESOME and TOTALLY KILLED IT! She was spinning Top 40s, Mash-Ups, Pop, Hip Hop and Throwbacks. She had me dancing ALL night! *FIST PUMP*

C R O W D
*Rowdy Frat boys, Napoleon Dynamite look-alikes, Eminem Wannabe's and The Situations "In-Training" doing the robot, leg windmills and slow dancing with imaginary mannequins. Sorry, but I've never seen such HORRIBLE dancing in my life. :X

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R
*Divey and unpretentious
*Pool Table
*Flat Screen TVs
*About 7-8 tables
*Platform for dancing
*EXTREMELY PACKED! Except to shove your way through.

R E S T R O O M S
*2 Stalls (My friend said it's dirty so I held it in till we went to Fizzee's up the block.)

P A R K I N G 
Street parking can be difficult. There's also tons of 5-O's in the area because of the police station a block away, so take MUNI or a cab.

Abbey's Tavern is normally NOT my scene but the music was crackin' and the drinks were dirt cheap so I have to give them 4 STARS. 

HIGHLIGHT OF THE NIGHT? When a bloody fight broke out outside of Abbey's and 5 cop cars showed up within minutes with a HAWT Asian Cop sitting in one of the cars. Gotta love men in uniform!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Best Guinness poor in the city. Great bands, especially the guitar and string harp cover band duo from Portland-- wish I got their name. I felt a bit like I was in Ireland here, complete with good company, dancing, good music and awesome Guinness, and that's a good thing. Hope to be back.
author: Brian J.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night!

Parking was easy, pitchers were cheapish ($10 for bud).

Bartender was nice, but it was a really really slow night.

Not my scene at all, but it seemed like a nice neighborhood bar.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Not the friendliest bar. Locals rule the service standard. Ie: the bartender talks more than she pours. If you don't know her, you get no service. No nothing by the way of anything. The bartender, she spent all of her possible time as far away from me as possible. As a single  woman I will never come back here again. So lame. So sad with women bartending. Can't support. Fuck this place, made to feel small.
author: Kathlyn A.

description: We heard a rumor that this was a "Seahawks bar" in SF, so naturally we had to stop in.... not a Hawks bar. BUT a good bar non the less.
author: April G.

description: Great bar to watch games!!! They are so spirited and the bartenders are great! Plus they have pool and darts for non-game nights!
author: Brianne H.

description:
BEST BAR IN THE CITY AS A 12TH MAN. Come here for all Seahawks games

https://www.facebook.com/SeahawksInSanFrancisco
author: Kevin S.

description:
I'm getting old for this shirt. 

At the 30, i need to reevaluate the term "Crackin!'

Crackin doesnt mean to over crowd the place to full capacity so i can rub my junk against another guy just to walk to the bar. 

Crackin doesnt mean to have a guy/girl ratio of 80/20

I guess i could have expected it if i knew it was college night on thurs. So i guess i would expect to see:

-Really loud music and turning the tavern into a club. 
-girls so drunk that its unattractive 
- the same drunk girls freak dancing against you cause there is no room to dance. 
- college guys wanting to share a bromance with each other. 
- and probably alot of things will happen that you will regret the next morning. 

its a triple threat: club, tavern, and a really young crowd. 

its up to you if you find that "Crackin!"
author: Ryan R.

description:
It's a dive, be prepared to swim.

Ladies watch your pockets, there be thieves about.

You go here freshmen and sophomore year, after that? Upgrade to Polk or something.
author: Cruz K.

description:
Nothing particularly stands out about Abbey Tavern, but after watching some wonderful live music here the other day, I also found very little to complain about as well.

Abbey Tavern is laid back, spacious, and seems to transform easily - according to the crowd. 

When I visited here the other day, their bartender was laid back and warm. He filled up my water glass on the regular with a kind smile. The small intimate stage situated on the right corner of Abbey's main floor is great for showcasing local talent. The sound throughout the performances that I watched, though loud and occasionally buzzing at times, traveled well within the space.

Outside of friendly staff and decent music capabilities, Abbey Tavern is just an easy-going hang-out spot. Their two floors allow for patrons to spread out and either linger by the bar downstairs, or head on upstairs to play either pool or fooz-ball. If you're interested in soccer or sports - this place can definitely get rowdy on big nights.

In the hood and seeking a warm inviting space to kick back and catch up over a cold drink? - The Abbey Tavern is a solid call.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
We walk into the bar on a Wednesday night because friends were in town. The bouncer is too busy trying to hit on my friend and does not check our ID"s. We walk in and the girls are on their way to the bathroom when the bartender starts yelling telling us to show him our ID's. We listen and he comes up with some ridiculous unnecessary comments.

My friend's ID is from Hawaii and he didn't take it. Is he so stupid or just ignorant? There are tons of people that go there from USF and it just so happens that many of them are from Hawaii. Anyways on to the next ID, he looks at the picture, and tells my friend, "there's no way you weigh this much." Then a drunk man yells at us and laughs because he thinks we are using fake ID's. That just did it for us. It's not our fault that stupid kids try using fake ID's and that the bartender is too busy looking at the weight as opposed to the information.

The funny part is that when I was a student at USF and went to Abbey, I would see all of the underage people taking drinks like it was water. 

We walked straight out of there and I will never go back to have an ignorant bartender disrespect us. If I could give this place negative stars, I would.
author: Briceyda L.

description:
Glad this place isn't popular because we got a table to watch the Giants beat the Phillies!  World Series, baby!!  I love Timmy Lincecum! 

Oh a review...cheap beer pitchers.  No table service.  Lots of screens to watch the game.  Big plus - can bring in own food.
author: Kim S.

description:
The bartender is rude, discriminatory, and unprofessional. Let me tell you the story.

So me & my two friends walk into this bar on a Wednesday night, there is no one at the door checking IDs. We head to the bathroom, when all of a sudden we hear "HEY HEY HEY!!!" in a loud and rude tone. We turn around and see that it's the bartender. He asks to see our IDs. We politely show them to him. After he hesitates over my friend's ID because she happened to have lost a lot of weight since her picture, he looks at mine for a second and says "No, I can't take this." 

My ID is a valid Hawaii state-issued ID and for some reason, he didn't believe it was real. I asked him why, all he said was "Nope, sorry can't take it." Then he kicked us out after all the people at the bar started chiming in and laughing at us, falsely accusing us of having fakes. We are all 22 years old, and this bartender didn't give a damn. 

It was the worst experience I had with a bartender and I will never be returning. He discriminates against people for looking young, regardless of them having a VALID ID! 

Don't waste your time at this bar - the workers and people are incompetent & rude. Go to Ireland's or Buckshot. They are a lot better.
author: Junel S.

description:
Man this place is weird dump. They don't serve food but allow you to bring your own. Now this is as good as it gets for this place. Filthy washroom (no soap no paper towels) 
Beer is cheap and I guess it caters to certain crowd. We were there for UFC 129 they had a 15$ cover!!!! and guess what no place to sit. smaller screens are ok but the big screen is washed out as there is too much light coming in. Very strange mix of people. I guess the cheap beer will lure some ppl but I guess I am not one of em.
author: Elvis A.

description:
Some friends and I wanted a place to go out and have a drink. Lo and behold, Abbey Tavern comes to our attention. Since we read there's $1 beer on the day we wanted to go, we thought it be a good idea to check it out. 

The space is cool, feels like a nice kick back and relax with your friends type of bar. There's the main floor and a little area in the back for you to play darts, pool, and foosball, and believe me, the competition is no joke. It's a fun spot to hangout and is affordable. 

Turns out the $1 is for bud light (cheap piss water beer) but if your a light weight and think it'll do you figure good by drinking such beer than your just a fool. They have a few types of beer on tap and in can/bottles but not as much as I hoped. The bartender most of the time turns out to be cool. During big games, they also show them on projectors in the main area so people can get pumped up for the games. 

On the downside, those college kids who go to school nearby with fake IDs always target this spot so be prepared for some ignorance, stupidity, overly dramatic fake drunk tactics, which can be explained as to why they have two guys acting as security at least. If your a dude and need to pee, be sure to keep a smile on your face since odds are if you Peeing someone on the street will be watching you do so. 

Abbey is solid, great for some drinking and games, worth a try once in a while.
author: Jesus A.

description:
Me and my friend were  looking for a place to grab a beer and chill after our late night dinner. We walked in because it was crowded and it looked like people were having fun. The doorman/bouncer spent too much time flirting with this kid with a fake ID. (He should have told him to gtfo and let other customers in).

I went up to the bar and tried to order a couple drinks for me and my friend. Keep in the mind the place was packed. I stood waiting for 10 minutes for a drink before I said *Screw this*. Me and my friend left without ordering anything. Thanks for wasting our time. It might have been on a Monday, I remember seeing a $1 a beer sign outside.

This is the first time I've ever given up on ordering a drink. I've been to packed clubs and after waiting a long time I can get my order in. Nope, not this place. I felt like the bartenders were purposely not making eye contact with me. And I'm a big guy. 6'2'' 225lbs. A little hard to miss, even in a packed crowd.
author: Dylan L.

description: "College Night on Thursdays" should already be enough to attract anyone to this place. You'd think with their prices that every hour of every day is happy hour but no it gets better. You get a dollar off well drinks, drafts and wines from 4pm-7pm. At first I didn't really believe it but after a quick check on Voo (https://tryvoo.com) I found out it was legit. Definitely worth checking out if your in the area.
author: Peter B.

description: Owners are awesome.  Hockey fans from all over came to watch the finals.  Great service, games, and TVs for sports.  Go Blackhawks!
author: Kevin M.

description:
It can be a bro scene, a sausage congested bro scene. And I'm assuming most of the people who come here are either got dragged in because their friend's hanging out here, too lazy to get out of Richmond, newly SF residents who previously resided in a suburb or just from out of town specifically from a suburb/foreign country.

And when I say suburban, we're talking about Fresno like. You know, those bros you see walking around SOMA whenever there's a ball game at AT&T and you know that for shit because they're causing 75% of the traffic since they don't know how to drive around SF. Or those bros you see hanging out in the Marina.

I'm won't be surprised if I get shit for this review.

Anything else, drinks are priced decently with good alcohol ratio.
But they play hip hop music sometimes for fuck sake's.
If you are a into that scene, then go here.
author: Colleen J.

description:
Let's hear it for real pubs with pub ambitions!
that's what the Abbey tavern is to me and that's why when I'm stumblin' through the Richmond like a lost, sports fiend with a yen for beer and whiskey I wind up here.

ME: bartender . . . bartender . . . bartender . . . bartender . . .
BARTENDER: WHAT!
ME: More of whatever I ordered, I can't remember.
BARTENDER: (blank stare and turns to a cute brunette who won't tip as well as I do)
ME: Fuck it (exit)
author: Alexander R.

description: I would give these place 0 stars if possible. I came here on Thursday around 12am and the place was packed..completely understandable that the bartenders are busy. This was the day the giants won the last NLCS game, so it would probably be smarter to overstaff. But definitely NOT understandable that my boyfriend and I stood AT the bar for 15 minutes waving the bartenders down to buy drinks. To make it worse we didn't even get acknowledged. One of the bartenders was definitely intoxicated and was not aware of the people all at the bar waiting to buy drinks. We even maneuvered to the other side of the bar to try again, no luck. We left very upset after trying so many attempts at trying to get a drink.
author: Vee T.

description:
Went to visit the Kid in Berkeley...The Abbey is somewhat famous among world-wide Glasgow Celtic/Liverpool fans and we were not disappointed...Very Celtic/Scouser oriented, so everyone "got" what we were talking about.  Great, old-world service and a wonderful, malty Saturday afternoon in congenial surroundings...Only regret is that I forgot to purchase the official Celtic polo shirt...On the way back to Berkeley, had to "strain the potatoes" three times!  The hallmark of a classic pub!

One important caveat:  In no way, in no words, indicate even a mild approval of Manchester Utd!  This may jeopardize your life-span.  (I heard Wayne Rooney referred to as "Shrek" for the first time in the Abbey!)
author: Jack S.

description:
I frequent Abbey because it is my local watering hole. Most of the bartenders are friendly and excellent. I love that they have a pool table and a relaxed vibe where you can bring in whatever food you want. 

I do find their tv situation awkward for s sports-like bar. There are several smallish TVs on top of the bar, which are fine if you snag a seat right there. Otherwise, those tvs are really hard to see, since they're smallish and tucked behind the bar. 

Only other issue is that they very frequently close off the bar for fights and charge a cover, which I'm sure is great for the business, but is a pain for anyone in the neighborhood wanting to pop in for a night cap.
author: Jenni D.

description: It's a college night alright on Thursday. There are a bunch of young folks and the place gets super duper crowded.
author: Minh H.

description:
I came here while on Vacation to watch a UFC event. During St patricks weekend. lol. 
So its safe to say that it was pretty roudy and loud. BUT, I had a great time. The bartenders were great and the atmosphere was good. 
If I was in the area, I would def go again to have a Shock Top. Cheers!
author: Lovelylms S.

description: You guys gave me a fake ten dollar bill. I guess this is more a poor review of your bartenders, who should have noticed in the first place.
author: Jaymie S.

description:
We go to Abbey Tavern on Thursday nights for the fun crowd, stiff, cheap drinks and great music.

Came here last night with a gf, the BF, his younger brother and some other friends. Drinks were super strong and cheap, 2 beers and a rum and coke made me wanna dance all night long to the music of the awesome dj they had last night. 

The BF woke up this morning STILL DRUNK. A good night, indeed!
author: Veronica C.

description: Had my first Guinness here! Great place to watch a game and friendly atmosphere. I love the bartenders very fun, love to make you feel at home.
author: Nadia N.

description: A good place to come after a sandwich at Bunn Mi up 5th Avenue. Older crowd on this night than the hipster vibe at Bunn Mi with live music and sports. Had their monthly feature pint Heroine IPA from "101North" for 4 bucks. $5 sandwich (see Bunn Mi review) + $4 pints + live music / walking distance = HAPPY! One negative was the ciggy smoke wafting in from outside.
author: Aaron L.

description: Wednesday open mic night a mixed bag but generally chill.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I walked in here for the first time in years to watch a not-so-popular college football game and was pleasantly reminded that The Abbey Tavern shows pay-per-view boxing and UFC fights. I had also forgotten that day was UFC 153. 

There's surprisingly a lot of room in this bar with its elevated pool room in the back. For big fights they line up some chairs on the main floor so if you're sitting at the bar, like I was, you can get boxed in. The crowd was full of cool people so they were willing to move if you needed to. 

Overall I think this is a good place to go if you want an affordable pint and want to watch sports. I do wish they served food though. I also knocked off a star because they need to update their overall TV setup if they're going to rely on sports.
author: eric f.

description:
A decent dive. They've got a random playlist or is it a jukebox? I don't remember but they played NWA followed by a depressing Radiohead song (No Surprises). They have popcorn too. I prefer chips. One night a drunk friend almost got his ass kicked for making fun of a British guys voice. 

It's also a nice sized space with booths and a pool table.
author: Shistain B.

description: Stumbled upon this place as I was waiting for Burma Superstar to open up.  This is a nice little neighborhood spot.  Spent some time chatting it up with the Irish bartender about the World Cup and had a pint of Speakeasy Big daddy.  If I didn't need to secure my spot in line at Burma, I would've hung out for a lot longer.
author: Alex K.

description:
I have little tolerance and zero patience for bartenders who are in la-dee-dah mode on a busy Saturday night. I'm not going to get into specifics and spend 3 paragraphs whining but that was certainly the case at this bar last Saturday. It would not be fair to call the pace at which the barkeeps were moving glacial. That would be an insult to global warming.

This area is one of my staples, but I usually stick to Buckshot or Ireland's 32. Now, after giving this place a try, I'm extra glad. The bartenders at those bars get it done, and the crowds are about the same. So why would you ever go here?

Well, because they have a huge projector screen to watch games on (the World Cup was a blast) besides the standard flat screens, and they have DJs who bring the noise from time to time. But seriously, bartenders, pull your heads out of your holes and focus on making drinks when it's busy. Maybe even move around quickly, I don't know. Damn, I just spent 3 paragraphs whining.
author: Lucas P.

description:
abbey tavern was one of the first iirsh bears i frequented decades ago. it was loud then. probably pricey too.  their guiness is great . it's  fresh since they sell so much. unlike other pubs where the beer sits around in kegs.

this was also the first and only place i've had a black & tan (guinness & harpes?)

parking's just too expensive is s.f. now. don't know when i will return here.
author: Victor G.

description: Great sports bar in the inner richmond. The bartender's are great, the drinks are cheap and there are a ton of TVs. No food, so you can bring in whatever you'd like. They had a bunch of Seahawks fans there, which was awesome. I saw many other teams represented tho, so definitely welcoming to all sports fans. Check this place out if you're in the hood and looking for cheap pints and nice service.
author: J S.

description:
I've gone to Abbey's for a few College Nights on Thursday nights with some friends.  If you're looking for cheap beers, this is the way to do it.  Can't beat $1 beers!  Of course, they are $1, so don't be expecting it to please your taste buds. 

Other than that, I've just had my typical Guinness (love) and a long island iced tea (do not get this, it's awful - BUT it will get you drunk quick).  The place gets pretty pack on Thursday night and there isn't that much move to move around.  They play pretty decent music, but there isn't really any room to dance so go elsewhere if that's what you're looking for.  

Oh another plus?  They play the Giants games.  $1 beers and free games?  Not a bad way to do it.  

Otherwise, it's more a connivence factor for me. There's Nizario's pizza just down the street and has delicious slices that are perfect for when you're hungry after drinking.  

Not a place to go out of your way for, but if you're living close to the area and are looking for a place to chill - it's perfect for that!
author: Michele P.

description:
Rolled in here mid-afternoon after Power to the Peaceful. It was nearly abandoned, as was my hope upon entering.

After we got a TV tuned to the game we wanted to watch we started getting accosted by older drunken Irish guys. 

Friend: Where the f**k are all the girls?
Drunk 65 y/o Irishman: I used to be a woman! *hugs friend and extends an enormous hairy leg over friend's lap*
Drunk 55 y/o Irishman: Yeah! *high-fives everyone at table, spittle flying everywhere*

Meanwhile, there was some kind of really weird 3-way PDA between two older woman and an angry looking guy hogging the dartboard all afternoon.

I can't think of any reason to go back, except that being able to tune the TV to the security camera was interesting.
author: Dylan ..

description: Kevin is my favorite bartender at this bar. This is a great bar. If you're in the neighborhood, stop in and say hi! They have darts and live music and Kevin is quick with a smile to light up your day!
author: Krysta G.

description:
This bar isn't particularly special but it is conveniently located across the street from my house. Also, I have a special place in my heart for this little gem, because it is where I learned how to play pool and darts very well. 

It can get crazy on weekend nights because it's located near USF but it is mostly a chill dive bar.  I love coming here on weekends for a little day drinking. Plus they always have Lagunitas on tap, point for Abbey's.
author: Talia M.

description:
Oh how I love them Irish (pubs). Irish pubs have always been my favorite kind of pubs cause they are always down to earth, good music and filled with friendly people who know things about sports.

The Abbey definitely fulfills that definition. It's a good spot to hang out with friends, meet new people and talk sports! On the weekends they have a DJ with many people dancing, talking and laughing! 

I do not get the bad comments about the bartenders. The bartenders here are real, they do not like the fake stuff you find in the Marina/North Beach/Downtown SF. They are very knowledgeable and friendly, and always open for a conversation. 

A big plus is that they allow you to bring in food!
author: Helen D.

description:
Oh, Abbey's. Where boys with fake IDs used to buy me $2 bud lites on Thursday evenings. *Sigh*, to be young again...

But a couple of years make all the difference. Even though I've recently moved a block away, the thought of coming here for any other reason besides refusing to start on a 10-page paper due in a few days and/or making out with your ex-boyfriend/current boyfriend/on again off again boyfriend seem hardly worth it.

I'd like to think I've grown up a LITTLE since college.

The Abbey, however, despite its "massive" renovations a few months ago looks exactly the same as it always did whenever I pass by. Sorry, but not even a shiny new set of floors, a few more plasma screens, or all the sparkly refurbished bar countertops in the world could transform you, Abbey's. Face it--some things, no matter how hard you try, never change.

I, on the other hand, have come a long way. I pay for my own cheap beer now, thank you very much.
author: Kate V.

description:
THURSDAYS. THURSDAY IS COLLEGE NIGHT. $1 bud/bud light $6 pitchers of bud. Sure it's just budweiser, but it's college night...what do you expect? If you have $5-20 in your pocket than you're king at this place.

Thursdays get pretty packed around 11pm with college kids mostly from USF and maybe SF State. Groups of girls roll in, groups of more guys roll in...you're typical bar ratio. Abbey has a DJ spinning all night and she's pretty good. They had 3 bartenders so it was pretty easy to get a drink.

Another awesome thing about Abbey Tavern is that it's located near a ton of fooooood. Get your drunk munchies on at Clement street yo.
author: Arnold N.

description:
This place is legit.

Prices are very reasonable
Friendly staff who know how to keep up with a conversation.
Relaxed vibe
Spacious
No douche bags

We need to support our local watering hole.

To quote Ben Stiller in the movie "Zoolander"

"Do it, do it"
author: Sun T.

description:
Abbey is a great neighborhood bar to visit.  This place isn't the most popular bar in the city, but I think it one of the best to watch sports in.   If you like dive bars, Irish bars, or sports bars this is the place to visit.    

There are definitely a handful of HDTV which makes it a perfect sports bar to visit.   No matter where you turn your head there is another TV with a game on.  If a game is not showing on TV, the bartenders are more than willing to try to accommodate you.  The staff is very nice.  They are always willing to talk to you and joke around with you.  

There is no food served here, but since you are right in the middle of Clement there is so many different places to pick up food, which is welcomed to bring in.  This is nice b/c then sometimes you are not stuck with whatever menu they have, so you can appease any craving that your drunkenness desires.  

Also another plus, dogs are allowed here.  If you are not a dog lover, not to worry, you rarely find dogs inside, but it's nice to know that you can bring in your dog for a drink or two.  

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that wants to enjoy a drink or two with friends.
author: Jeremiah K.

description:
Mr. A Tavern,

Unfortunately, my good sir, MPD - Multiple Personality Disorder - is the diagnosis. you really gotta make up your mind at this point; are you an irish pub, an american sports bar, fratboy hangout, hip-hop lounge, or eurotrash disco? alas, your earnest attempt at being well rounded has left you in complete disarray. you're advised to pick one personality (ok, maybe you could ultimately handle two) and just stick with it. until you find your true identity. patrons should avoid your premises at all costs or run the risk of feeling like a confused filthy pigeon upon exiting your doors.
author: Art O.

description: Nice and low key, I wish they had a menu of the beers on tap. Maybe they do, but I didn't see any. The bartender was pretty cool and there are pool tables and a dart board where you and some friends can go ahead and challenge each other while taking it easy in the city.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Decent prices, tvs and giant screen for games, and free wifi!  perfect for a drink, a game (including soccer) and a bit of work.

Granted this experience was during the day, and it is evident the scene changes for pm.
author: Corinna K.

description:
Came here for the World Cup Final with my roommates. Place was pretty packed but they had projectors with the game on on every wall possible. That was cool.

Carlsberg was $3 for the "beer of the month"...that was cool. 

Spain won. It was cool.

This experience was pretty cool, may there be more to come.
author: Lauren S.

description:
There's nothing fancy about Abbey Tavern, but then I don't think they give a rat's anus about being fancy. It's grubby, grimy, and cheap. You can bring your own food in, and the bartenders are pretty chill. And with the exception of some early morning weekends when you might find some rowdy, hammered soccer fans hanging out, the people at the bar are just your run of the mill, neighborhood regulars. 

I found this place about four or five years ago when I was looking for somewhere close to home to catch NFL games that weren't being televised locally. They have numerous TVs that are usually all tuned to sporting events. People show up wearing their team's gear, and everyone is pretty laid back about it. I've never seen anyone get heated or aggressive. It hardly ever gets crowded to the point that you feel uncomfortable - at least on Sunday mornings - but there are usually enough people around to make it interesting.

I was a regular on Sundays for a few years until I figured out how to stream the games for free on my PC at home. I still go back occasionally when I just feel like getting out of the house to see a game. I wouldn't recommend going here if you're looking for something trendy or modern, but if you live in the Inner Richmond and you just want to grab a cheap drink while watching whatever sporting event happens to be going on, you could do worse than the Abbey Tavern.
author: Don W.

description: I saw my favorite local band here The Straight Ups and it was awesome. They have decent space and a pool table. The bathrooms were roomy too!
author: Samantha B.

description:
Flashback to 1995

The blood that flows in my veins is 1/4 Irish blood.  My old friend George was full Irish.  We both liked opium tea, smoking pot and dipping our cigarettes into a pile cocaine while we smoked them.  He showed me how to pull out some of the tobacco from the end of a cigarette.  You pull out a little and then you suck a line of cocaine into your cigarette by inhaling hard into the cigarette as you run the tip of the cigarette across the line.  He called it a "coke smoke."  Sometimes after a few coke smokes we would go do graffiti around SF...sometimes in the MUNI tunnels.

Anyways, good ol' Irish George loved Abbey Tavern.  I was more into dance clubs...not Irish bars at the time...I was through my Irish bar phase, lol.  I had already been there one time but I didn't really like it much and didn't go back until Irish George made it sound so great.  So they had different theme nights, I forget what the theme of the night was...but everyone was in their early 20s..  There was an Irish female bartender there I enjoyed talking to.  

George and I and a couple other friends would go there and flirt with people and go outside get stoned and then come back in.  It was really fun.  Excellent beer selection.  I could talk to people about Beamish and if it was better than Guinness or not.  

Last time I saw old Irish George it was in the East Bay and he shocked me by injecting heroin into his arm while his friend did the same thing in front of me in George's car without any warning.  

George had moved up from opium tea to injecting heroin.  He was always such a hippie potsmoker so I was pretty shocked.  George and his friend wanted some more heroin or some crack and so we went to Oakland and I went along for the exciting ride.  That was the last time I saw George.  I have no idea if he is still alive, homeless, sober or what.

I can't go back to Abbey Tavern anymore because it makes me really sad.  Reminds me of George.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Only been here for Cinco de Mayo...

It was quite old-fashioned looking, from the outside.  The inside was still old-fashioned looking, but they had strobe lights, a DJ, and plenty of booze binging.  

It was a good time.  Even if parking was a pain, as well as lack of seating!
author: Fannie S.

description:
A fun, unpretentious pub with a mellow neighborhood crowd, featuring a strong Irish contingent and some USF students, and reasonably priced drinks.  Very popular for sports, with lots of big screens all over the place, and has been developing into a pretty solid live music venue as well.

In recent months the owner has been making a serious effort to improve the Abbey as a place for live music: he's expanded the stage, which makes it a lot better for bands to set up without spilling onto the dance floor, and he's also extended the live music schedule to include Saturdays when there isn't a major PPV sporting event.  Usually no cover for music, and the bands range from folky to all-out rock and roll.
author: Alex S.

description:
We searched far and wide for a place to watch the pac-man fight and to my surprise nothing within walking distance was showing it.  That was a big shock since there are a lot of sport's bars in my area.  But none like abbey's.  now that is a major big-time sports bar!  

I've never seen a bigger screen or more screens in one place.  This is an event watching venue without a doubt.  $20 cover, which I take it was required, because of the amount they paid for the privilege of showing the fight.  The screen was the size of a small AMC theater screen.  They set the place up with chairs. The beers were flowing and reasonably priced.  Much of the crowd was latino since the fight schedule had a couple of fighters, including Margarito from Mexico.  They didn't have much to cheer about since Margarito got totally pummeled by Manny P.  btw, note-worthy is that the main fight was scheduled for 6pm but didn't actually start till after 8pm.  Guess that's the way they always announce those things.
author: dan h.

description: Abbey Tavern is a hugely underrated bar! Great live music and decent DJs, darts and pool, and friendly patrons including a local 20 to 30-something crowd and jovial, often wasted, Irish imports. Also a great place to watch soccer.
author: Alison H.

description:
The bar is whatever. In case that wasn't helpful let me enumerate. For starters, the music here is almost always lame. Granted I can be a little snobby about what I listen to, but if you're preferential to rock, you'll most likely find their electronic and hip hop selection pretty awful. And for me, music is everything so that by itself is a deal breaker. And then there's the type of people this place draws, bro's and law students. Not my cup of tea. 
Aside from that it's in a decent part of the richmond and is close to Buckshot and Ireland's so that's a little plus. It's got a foosball and pool table in the back. What else. There's dollor drink nights on Thursday, unfortunately that's like the most bro packed night of the week. If you're into watching sports and grabbing a drink this place isn't bad, but I prefer the Bitter End. If it wasn't 2 blocks away from my house I would never have even checked this spot out. And since I have, ehhhh.
author: Bobby R.

description:
03.17.10

St. Patrick's Day Pub Crawl - stop three.

Wait, is this a dance club or a tavern?  I think the former, with the latter as a front.

There was a cute boy with a hello kitty t shirt that night!  Extra star for fun patrons.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Favorite neighborhood bar.  Not much for decor or elegence, but just a good, comfortable place to grab an evening drink or watch a big game.  Drinks are cheap by city standards and people at the bar will always strike up a conversation with you.  To top it off, I don't think i've been here when there hasn't been a visitor from Ireland here.

In short, not worth driving in from the 'burbs for,  but if you're anywhere in the neighborhood and want a super casual bar to hangout at, this is the spot.
author: Richard F.

description:
Hip Hop music at an Irish Pub? That sounds doable. 

This was my third location for my pub crawl. The atmosphere was more similar to a club scene. There was a DJ playing and the crowd was open and friendly. 

The bar was busy for St. Patrick's day but not overwhelming. There were people dancing on the dance floor and it was quite enjoyable.  The bartenders seemed a little overwhelmed due to the amount of people inside but they were very friendly. The bartender was cool and the alcohol was cheap. 

This bar did not try to gouge you due to St. Patrick's Day. For once everything fell into place and was perfect.
author: Pete N.

description:
ONCE UPON A YEARS AGO...

(i believe this is the place) I came here when someone rented this place out for a night to throw their event. I was with this guy and his sister was all about these underground scenes you can only go if you were invited. I came here for my first time because of the invite. This dive-bar turned into a little fashion show/activist movement night. The scene was cool. The drinks was strong. All i remember was running out of the bar, drunk, emotional, and my friends chased me down and found me a few blocks away sitting on someones doorsteps crying. I guess the drinks did its job. LOL
author: Jane A.

description:
What's to like about this place? 

This is a bar, not a nightclub. People go to bars to talk and not to listen to music. When I came here the music was too loud to comfortably have a conversation and therefore this place fails at the basic level as a bar.

I seem to remember the beers being $5 a pint so they were about %25 too expensive for the location and venue.

The bartender was fairly unfriendly. They have a sign outside advertising Czechvar  but when I asked for it the guy looked at me like I was insane.

Since the place was nearly empty on a Saturday night I don't think I'm the only person that doesn't like it.

I don't see any set of circumstances that would lead to me returning.
author: Manny F.

description:
They recently remodeled the upper area which is a host to nice restrooms, a pool table, and a dart board. 
 
The lower portion of the bar is a few bar tables accompanied by a medium sized area which people dance on.

The clientele seem a bit out of my element, but Abbey tavern has never shown me a poor experience.

[ + ]

Something for everyone. Dance floor, semi-dive bar, pool, darts, and soccer!

[ - ]

Service may sag sometimes, but to their credit - they are pretty busy.

Prices seem to be a bit sharp compared to the bitter end and alike bars just 1 block away.
author: Peter T.

description: Love coming here when there is a fight showing. Very comfortable environment! Went on St. Patty's day and they had a Celtic band that was awesome!
author: SairUh B.

description: Cheap drinks, very chill and friendly bartenders. This place is also very spacious with the backside with games. They are also dog friendly and allow outside food. Open mic on Wednesday is fun.
author: April E.

description:
Came here for UFC 109. They charged a cover of $15...not too bad. They were really cool about not pushing drinks on us every 5 minutes. I really liked the vibe of the place. I can tell that this is a great pub.

Majority of the crowd were cool people. But it only takes one guy to ruin a night. And that guy is apparently a regular at abbey tavern. 

Every 10 minutes, he felt the need to scream at the top of his lungs at the tv and jump out of his seat and pantomime like he is fighting someone....in the center of the bar. It was just too much...really distracting, annoying, and immature. 

Thing is...while I really liked the joint, I actually don't think I will come back for future UFC events. I could really like this bar...but I think I need to visit on a non UFC PPV event night to confirm that.
author: Rondeep C.

description: I finally found a bar that has the NHL CENTER ICE package!!!
author: Brandon N.

description:
Because I'm a poor law school student, I will rate on value.

$6 pitcher of Bud Light on Tuesday and Thursdays. It will take you like a half an hour to reach the bartender (maybe because we went on a Bar Night without telling the establishment. woops.) but once you get there, get two. You will have a fabulous time!

The music is alright. People dance. It gets packed (maybe because of us). 

Oh! And the lady's bathroom was decent.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I would give this place 3.5 stars based on college night, aka thirsty Thursday's. 

$1 bud light, $6 pitcher- I'm there! Especially with top 40's music. 

The day I came here to celebrate my friend's birthday, it was super packed! We got there at like 10:45pm and there was literally a line halfway through the block......I have never seen abbey tavern with a line out the door! There was a group of 6 in front of us and after waiting for about 10mins, we finally got it.  Music was awesome but trying to a drink was the hardest part. Took me about 10-15 min to get a damn pitcher but I totally understand why. C'mon, it's $1 bud light and $6 pitcher! 
Though it's college night and my friends and I are way past that time, we still like to enjoy getting drunk and having awesome music to dance to. We left at 12:30 bc it was still overcrowded, ppl were spilling drinks all over the place and the music changed a little. I commend ppl who can seriously dance and drink that night! Sweaty guys and drunk college girls.....that's all I can say about this place.
author: Irene L.

description:
Every time I've gone in here, I've had a great time. My friends and I tend to stagger in here at the end of the night, so listening to the booming music is just what we are in the mood for. 
On occasion we've headed over there on a week night. It is not the place to be and that is solely the reason for the 4 star.
author: Lily Y.

description:
Everything in my opinion was great, except for some of the customers. If you've ever heard the stereotypical term Irish Drunk, this is the destination to see them. There was this one Irish guy who was extremely drunk), and as I was heading to the back to use the bathroom, he said to me, "The people need to call immigration and deport you back to where you came from." I didn't care if he was joking or not, but when one's drunk, they don't make the best decisions. I highly doubt I would ever come back here again after that experience.

P.S.- If I wanted to hear more about Irish drunks, I would read Angela's Ashes again.
author: Gerry L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night to watch some UFC action!

Guess I'd label it your "typical" SF Irish bar w/all the interior accoutrements and wall ephemera. They do have a good selection of UK brews on draught, along with some Carlsberg. The bartenders are cool and quick on their service.

Probably one of the better places in the city to watch UFC and get bent at the same time. Too bad Chuck Liddell lost. :-(
author: Gary T.

description: I want to like this place but I don't. It is not the most welcoming place and has limited seating. They have live music but its typical bar band stuff.
author: Jordan P.

description:
This review needs to be broken into two sections.

DAYTIME- Come here in the daytime and you will find a large screen TV and many other small ones displaying the latest and greatest soccer game (or some other random sport). You can grab a good beer or strong/cheap drink, mingle with the guys who's asses may very well be planted to the bar stools. There's one crappy pool table with walls a little too tight to make a great shot and random games in the back. Bathrooms are fairly clean, place smells like an Irish pub should (old stale beer). Sometimes there's food, but I recommend getting pizza nearby if you're hungry for something edible. 

NIGHTTIME - This place is a whole different scene when the sun goes down. The regulars stumble off their stools and either pass out so they wake up at 6am to do it again the next day or move to another pub (like Fizzee's) where they won't be bombarded by 18 year old drunkards. 

Dancing is always fantastic here. My bouncer always knows he's gonna get a great show as soon as I walk in. I was a regular on the dance floor for many years until the 18 year olds started annoying me too much. Now and then I still travel back for a great workout. I absolutely LOVE to dance and am usually 'that girl' who's dancing by herself and singing along to every song that comes on. If you see me here, I will challenge you to a dance off and I will win. My friends have started limiting my time here because I don't they can keep up. Dancing here is definitely on my happy list.

DJs are either extremely nice or extremely rude. They DO take requests even if they sometimes tell you they don't. 

Jaegger-Bombs are my drink of choice from this bar. Their drinks are always strong and pretty cheap. 

Things to watch out for:
-Fake Irish Accent Boys (they do it to get chicks, don't be one of the stupid ones who falls for it)
-The crazy of the night. Don't get stuck in a convo/ dance-off with them. But, do watch and humor yourself as I guarantee you the crazy of the night is always entertaining. 
-Jailbait - He/she may look 21, but beware.. it's possible they are 16 and I doubt Daddy allows one night standers in.

**The only reason this place doesn't 5 stars is for the lack of other normal people here.
author: Ali R.

description: I never understood the "Shabbey Tavern" tag this place got saddled with.  The bartenders are polite, knowledgeable, and ready to facilitate all of the drinking action.  College Nights can be a bit loud and obnoxious, but other than that it's a pretty laid back place to quench your thirst (Especially if you like Keg Killin').
author: Michael D.

description:
This bar is THE SHIT.

First thing you notice as you walk up is the cutest bouncer I have ever seen. He's also smart enough to turn away girls without pants and/or sloppy drunk creepers. After you walk in, one look at the bartender with the black Giants hat and any girl will be sold. Drinks are dirt cheap and oh sooo good. Everyone that works here is beyond nice unless you're a fuckin idiot. Thursday nights can be a little crowded but such good music! They have more TV's than your parents house will ever hope to have. 

The regulars are nice as well.
author: Jesi D.

description: A good little college kid bar, lots of USF hotties hang out here on certain nights.  Gramps owned and operated the pool table and games here for a long time.
author: Rick H.

description:
I come here for PPV events.

Average door fee....average drink cost....

Good MMA crowd i guess... i still remember everyone cheering like crazy when Machida own Rashad. Great atmosphere during fights. I rarely see douchebags with Tapout or Affliction shirts here too during these nights.
author: Steven C.

description:
This place is getting geometrically worse by the day it seems. Doing their absolute best to ruin a nice little Irish neighborhood sports bar, The Abbey has recently discovered that there's cash to be made by appealing to retro-emo college assholes by blasting crappy music and turning the place into the Richmond's answer to a square cow fun bar*.

I'm givin' ya two stars as a warning. Stop pandering and get back to your basics, Abbey!

* - Found in awful suburbs throughout America, Square Cow Fun Bars are offshoots of Stuart Andersen's Steak restaurants that are basically meat market singles bars that cater to dried up single moms and desperate used car salesmen.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Who wants to feel like they are watching the World Cup in the NY subway at rush hour? Not me!

Unlike some pubs, they do NOT charge, there is NO line for the toilets, and it is easy (ok, not too hard) to get a seat and order a drink. We had a blast and the best Irish Bloody Mary there. Trust me, you want the Bloody Mary.

Even though they don't serve food, the staff is pretty casual about bringing in your own food - when we were there for the US game, people brought in their own snacks - pizza, dim sum, sandwiches. 

Comfortable, cheap and friendly. That's what I'm talkin' about.
author: Kari G.

description:
I can't say that I've ever had the best of experiences in the Richmond area, but this place was pretty fun, even during the middle of the day. Don't let the dark tinted windows fool you, it may look closed, but drinks are already flowing pretty early in the afternoon. 

The crowd was usuals as I guess, even during crowded nights, would be sprinkled in the packs of college kids. The authenticity was amazing, an Irish owner and bartender on staff today made me feel like I was in a pub, rather than a bar. 

Great for a drink and a chat, and it seems like the nightlife is always popping as there were tons of signs promoting a slew of upcoming events.
author: Tony C.

description: Having recently moved to the Richmond District, I am glad I found this bar which is walking distance to my house. Beers are cheap and the crowd is a chill one.
author: Darius A.

description:
Abbey Tavern is another classic story of continuous struggle. In the early 2000's this place was packed in like sardines and looked similar to what you'd see in a coors light commercial. People were dancing, drinking and having fun. Lots of irish guys going crazy with their booze. 

It started going down the hill in late 2004 and hasn't been able to recover since. Every saturday you walk in, it's the same ol empty feel with not a whole lot going on. In essence it turned into another dive bar.

Going forward, I will keep monitoring this situation because I still think it has massive potential but for now all bets are off.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: Bar tenders during the week (don't know about weekends) really do not pay attention to anyone but the "bar flies" that have been posted in the stools for half the night.  Seems like a really awesome place for regulars, everyone else, don't expect much.
author: M R.

description:
I went to the Abbey Tavern for the Juan Manuel Marquez vs Juan Diaz boxing fight.  I'm not too into boxing but I went to tag along with one of my friends who would be stuck watching the fight alone.  I arrived at 6:45 pm on a Saturday and it was pretty empty.  It was very dark and most of the televisions were set for the fight.  There were a few others that were on a soccer game (probably because the owner was Irish).  

Let's discuss the venue.  Parking is quite difficult but I was lucky and parked down a neighboring street.  The location is decent . . . in the heart of the Richmond District.  The bar is on a corner and shares the block among a variety of good restaurants.  The Abbey Tavern is very dim inside and it is somewhat clean.  I guess you shouldn't expect cleanliness in a bar, right?  There are two levels.  The first level (main level) has a big screen television (projection on a wall) and a few other smaller televisions on a wall above the bar.  The second level has a pool table, the restrooms and a pin ball machine.  We were lucky enough to have the cubby seating on the second level and play pool while we watched the fights.  

I was pleased to discover that they have IPA on tap.  YUM!  The bar manager/owner is very nice and was kind enough to turn the television up (the only one they had upstairs) when we couldn't hear the fight too well due to the background noise.  He also kept filling up our snack bowl with Chex Mix to complement our ice cold IPA beer.  I ran into two Irish patrons and they were extremely nice and very talkative.  I'm sure they were drunk given they were slurring their words but it's always nice to talk to kind drunk folks.  

I would definitely come here again.  I think more people should patron this bar as I feel it's a hidden gem in the Richmond.  Most bars in the Richmond and Sunset are run down and have bad service.  The owner/manager of Abbey Tavern is very nice and is very welcoming.  I had a great experience here and will not hesitate to stop by the Abbey Tavern for a beer . . . IPA of course.
author: Manton R.

description:
A big fat, stinky urinal that serves warm, stale beer.  I keep going back with hopes that I will catch the bar on a clean day ... esp since they are one of the only places in the city that shows HBO boxing.  Trust me ... I'm a fan of the dive bar ... but not ones where the bathroom funk wafts throughout the bar.

Every time I've gone there we've seen the same two old asian men glued to the projection television.  Same spot. They never move. They never take a drink. I think their screwdrivers are growing mold.  Maybe that's the source of the stench??
author: Nada b.

description:
IMHO, the Abbey is the best pub in SF for watching the World Cup.  There are lots of enthusiastic "football" (soccer) fans here, including many of the staff, and they are happy to clarify disputed calls and discuss the different teams.  There is no cover charge for most soccer games, including the world cup.

For sports, the Abbey tends to be less crowded than other pubs, and its easier to get a seat close to the games.  There are two levels, so you can watch a game different from the one in the main area and get sound for your game.  Plus there are always specials on beer, like $3 for Carlsburg all hours for the World Cup.

The Abbey is also a great sports bar in general, with NFL, MLB, MMA, boxing.  Plus as others have mentioned there are music nights with DJs, live music, dancing, all no cover.
author: Les R.

description:
Carlsberg on tap! Opens early for important EPL matches!
Came here at night one time, interesting crowd. Younger. Cash only.


You are my Arsenal, my only Arsenal, 
You make me happy when skies are grey, 
You'll never notice how much I love you, 
Please don't take my Arsenal away.... !
author: Sven S.

description:
All right, fine, I love this place. The key is to go there on the right night at the right time. I avoid Tuesdays (keg night), Thursdays (student night), and Friday-Saturday nights (obvious reasons) because I'm really over the whole fight-your-way-to-the-bar-and-be-ogled-by-drunken-USF-students thing. 

On the other nights and during the day, you can walk into the Abbey and it's like being in Ireland. You have a good chance of being the only person who lacks an Irish accent. There are old men reading the paper or watching the footie while nursing pints of Guinness or glasses of whiskey. The bartender spends most of his time chatting with the guys at the end of the bar and watching the footie. It's quiet and dark and a bit dingy. People smoke in the bathroom (as one 4-year-old guest told his dad on returning from it a few weeks ago).

Go there often enough and they'll just get you your drink without asking what you want. Bring cash (they do have an ATM if you forget), and be prepared to fend off inappropriate come-ons from disreputable-looking older men with incomprehensible accents. God, I love it.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I'm not a pub connossieur, but this seems like a great pub.  Pretty cheap beer (with beer specials....though not on St. Patty's Day), a great one-man Irish band (he played the guitar and sang....his computer played the rest) and a lively atmosphere.  The Irish singer/band was awesome because he sang traditional Irish songs (so they tell me)...and modern stuff.  And, to the joy of my friend's boyfriend, they were also playing rugby.  The numerous TV screens make it a great place to watch football - American or otherwise.  :-)
author: Wendy L.

description: Abbey Tavern is a super laid back neighborhood bar. All the boys (and girls) go here to watch sports and games on the big screen TVs. I personally like the feel of the bar a lot. It's never too noisy, so I can count on having a decent conversation with the person next to me. This place is spacious, and the prices are reasonable. I hear there's live music performances regularly, so I definitely want to come back soon!
author: Linda T.

description:
Have you ever experienced a blackout in the middle of the night? Have you ever fallen into a black hole? If you haven't and are looking for the thrill, come on over to Abbey Tavern in the middle of the day, open the front door, step inside, and watch as all light is sucked from your surroundings. I went in with a tan, and left albino. In case you're slow... READ: It's friggin' dark in there!

On the plus side, draft beer prices aren't too bad, you can bring in your own food, and they have a bunch of TVs to show all of the football games. Just bring a flashlight so you can find your way to the bar.
author: Dave L.

description:
This review is strictly from the perspective of a fight fan evaluating a sports bar and I have no idea what the night life is like here period.

If you are a boxing or MMA fan you should already be familiar with Abbey Tavern. If you're not then you need to catch up because Abbey Tavern is truly a fight fan's paradise. Now that my beloved Ricky's has cut down on their fight schedule I have made increasing trips across the Bay Bridge to Abbey Tavern to fill my fix for The Sweet Science. Every major and even minor fight in boxing is shown here. If you don't have cable, don't want to pay 50 bucks for a huge ppv, and don't have enough friends to split ordering a ppv Abbey Tavern's got your back (there's a standard $20 cover to get in). 

The bartenders are all friendly (and generous with the drinks) and the regulars are highly educated fight fans who actually know what they're talking about. They're friendly as hell too. Once when I was there to watch the Cotto/Judah fight the guy sitting at the table next to me actually shared his pizza with me and refused to let me buy him a drink. I was starving and had asked him how much the pizza cost him and instead of telling me he proceeds to share half of his! That pretty much sums up my experience here.  Speaking of food Abbey Tavern doesn't serve any but you're welcome to bring food outside food and on their block alone you've got a choice between a pizzeria, Chinese restaurant, or Taco Bell & KFC. 

But all of that is really secondary to the fact that this bar is a truly reliable source to catch any and all boxing fights. They have also started to broadcast UFC ppvs although they have yet to air MMA cards from any other promotion. So the next time you don't know where you'll catch the big fight don't worry cuz Abbey Tavern's got it.
author: Mike C.

description:
Could I give a place that shows the Bhoys from Celtic anything less than five stars?

Not a chance in hell.

Although I find their cover charge rather high for a match in the middle of the week no experience is quite like taking a PTO day off work, strapping on the club jersey and sitting with like minded individuals who hang on every single movement of the ball.

The derby matches start at some ungodly hour on those Saturday dates but are mercifully replayed throughout the day. The Champion's League matches are just perfect, right in the middle of the day.
author: Michael H.

description:
This place is terrible i cannot understand why it is so packed. Read this and avoid at all cost

My friends and i are international students at sf state and we we're told to try an Irish bar. After looking around we decided to go for the Abbey Tavern because it looked like a pretty nice place to go (from the website) We went out to this bar for a friends 24th birthday and got to the entrance at about 11pm, thinking we would have plenty of time to get through the 8 person long line and have a drink before the clock struck 12. Instead the bouncer stopped letting people in just before The birthday boy got entrance. We waited at least 25 mins at the front of this line, watching scores of people leave the bar, wondering why we weren't allowed in. All this time the bouncer's 2 drunk friends were mocking the guys at the front of the queue and he did nothing about it. By this point my friend was having one of the worst birthdays ever so tried a ditch attempt to gain entry after a large group of people left the entrance. 
I person tried to enter after 8 people left. The birthday boy was dragged out of the bar and basically told to go t other back of the line, by which point had grown to at least an hour wait.

So in total my friend's birthday night out involved waiting in line for over an hour and getting abused by the people that a bouncer is supposed to deal with and for what? 2 of our group actually managed to get in and said it was a bog standard Irish bar, nothing special.

For an attraction such as this, The Abbey Tavern truly went out of their way to ruin what could have been an enjoyable evening
author: Tristan L.

description:
I LOVE ABBEYS. and i hate all you people who hate abbeys. maybe wen i'm 40 years old like you guys are now, i'll love you, but then again you'll be 61 by then and still be complaining about how immature i am. i'm sorry that the legal drinking age in america is 21 and that drinking to the point of intense inebriation probably won't be out of my system til i'm atleast 40, but hey i don't make the rules and i dont break them (im lying).

i have so many stories and blurry "memories" here. I go almost every thursday and always have a great time. i love the bartenders and the bouncers, they are such sweeties!

if you're looking for jesus christ or princess diana you won't find them here. but if you're looking for britney spears or peter doherty this is your spot! hollllllllllllllaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!
author: Lillian P.

description:
if you're here on a thursday past 9 PM, expect only to see underage college students. seriously. it will be dirty and sweaty and crowded.
we tipped the bartender $7 each in the beginning of the night to make sure he serves us instead of a bunch of underage students but he called us rude and expected not to serve us the whole night.
and the bouncer is rude as well.
author: Anisa B.

description: Called first to see if they we're showing the Cotto-Mayorga fight.  Was told "Yes...starts at 7:30...no cover."  Sweet!  Probably should've detected something amiss at that point, as the Cotto-Mayorga card actually started at 6PM.  Got there after coming over from the Northeast Bay only to be disappointed that they weren't showing Showtime's Cotto-Mayorga fight after all, but an HBO card with little-known fighters.  Bar wasn't that crowded for a Saturday night, and most people in the joint looked like they were having about as much fun as being in traffic.  Speaking of traffic in a similar vein, parking around this area is horrible as well.  Was there about 10-15 min. before turning around and leaving after not having been approached by the bartender.
author: Darrin K.

description:
I come to this place to watch boxing matches on tv.  You can meet a pretty interesting crew of leathery ex-fighters who hang out here and tell stories about their days in the ring and such.   Bring some food in with you, get a beer and listen to some tall tales about the glory days of the SF amateur boxing scene.  

Every now and then some complete asshole will show up, start chanting "there's only ooooooooone Ricky Hatton!", and then spray everyone with shaken up Miller Lite, but such goings on are rare. 

More often than not, you will find somebody with very strong opinions about boxing, who won't hesitate to talk your ear off throughout an entire hour-long HBO program that you're trying to watch, only to disappear suddenly and inexplicably at the end.  

Buy that guy a drink.


*************************************************************************************************************************
5/11/15

I've been coming to the Abbey for over a decade now.  The first boxing match I watched here was Trinidad vs Mayorga.  The last one was Canelo vs Kirkland, this past weekend.

Aside for just boxing matches, I've come here to watch various games, to kill time waiting for a table at nearby restaurants, and I've even held a fundraiser here for a local non-profit.

This place just feels like a real San Francisco institution.  It's a different feel from the popular, touristy lounges and sports bars that you'd find east of Van Ness or north of Union.  Joe Montana isn't walking through those doors anytime soon.  

You might find someone like Paris Alexander or Pat Lawlor hanging out here though.  Eventually, I expect to see Karim Mayfield pass through.  Look them up if you don't recognize those names.  

They still show fights as advertised, and reliably, even when some douche-canoe insists on having them change the channel on the tv because they don't realize that last weekend's ppv replay comes before tonight's live main event, and the show isn't over when the ppv replay ends on HBO.

I'm glad I found this place.
author: Gopal R.

description:
I started coming here after the demise of Pat O'Shea's down the street, so I could catch my NY Jets and NY Giants football games (yes, I root for both) early on Sundays. Most of the time, the networks won't show those teams, unless they're playing teams in the West. So, I transplanted myself over to this joint, and was happy to find like-minded NY fans (a couple of whom I used to see at O'Shea's) rooting on the old hometown teams. Always great to have like-minded people to celebrate (or commiserate) with.

Depending on my mood (and whether I had anything to do that day), I could either consume some of their good, strong coffee, or (even better) a Bloody Mary or 2 while cheering/jeering my teams and opponents. There was usually a solid representation of fans from other cities, and the bar has a series of TV's tuned in to every game, so I/we could see how other teams in our divisions were faring. I even brought my roomie Fernando over there when he moved in a little over a year ago, and we'd use the pool table in back while catching games on the Tube.

However, up until this past weekend, I hadn't been in to the bar, since nearly every week, I'd been able to catch my NY teams on regular TV (including the Jets-Giants matchup a couple weeks back, which is very rare on national TV).
