So, I struggled in after another late-nite at Mezzanine to see the Jets/Eagles game last week, and found the place nearly empty. There were a few scattered people at the bar (including some Eagles fans, ugh) and maybe another 1/2 dozen types sprinkled in. Another small group was catching European Soccer on a screen in the curtained-off lounge area upstairs, but that was it.

I was a bit disappointed/perplexed, but I grabbed a chair nonetheless, and had myself a couple seriously good Bloodies, while watching my Jets struggle to score. The owner recognized me and noted I hadn't been in recently, which was kinda cool. The Jets lost, however. 

It would seem that digital cable, satellite and even NFL.com (games to the desktop PC) have stolen people away from the bar, which is too bad. It's way more fun to see a game with a group in general, I think.

Oh well, at least those Bloodies still rock, and they missed me, so I'll be going back on Sundays as time permits...

[Update]

Been catching games sporadically, since my hometown NY JETS and NY GIANTS have both been on national TV quite a bit. However, when I do go, I still get some of the best Bloody Marys in SF, and I have a few expatriate NYer's to either celebrate or commiserate with. The lovely lass behind the bar each Sunday takes good care of me, and the owners are 2 really nice guys who always say hi to me and spend time chatting. 

In fact, they invited me to DJ there on New Year's Day 2011! I'm extremely pleased and honored to make my debut there, so come get a little "hair of the dog" with me and kick off 2011 in true Rock 'n' roll fashion!!!
author: ACE A.

description: Good place for beer, dancing, and random hookups.
author: Em L.

description:
I always have a fun time here. It's not really a pub; it's more like a good bar with good music and a decent-size dancefloor, which, to me, is the optimal setting for a perfect Saturday night. I love that most people dance here, but that enough people sit back to play pool or hang out so there's a little something for everyone.

I just drink beer here, but my friends indulge in their cheap Long Islands and eventually end up emptying their stomachs on some poor 5th Avenue denizen's driveway.

It's not too crazy here (when the USF kids aren't around), so it's definitely our go-to place for guaranteed, wholesome, drunken, fun.
author: Sachi T.

description:
Don't go there on a Thursday night! This place is pack full of under-aged college kids drinking and being rowdy. Maybe it's me, I'm over those college years. If that's what you're into, this place is for you. 

Pack house = hard time getting drinks  

Other than college kids, this setting is alright.
author: Stanley K.

description: You need to serve food... Please? I don't know - Just the fact that you have "Sports Bar" on your sign would make me assume that you have at least third rate buffalo wings and fries, right? I would eat it!  Just sayin'.......
author: Kelly T.

description: We stopped in here to wait for a dinner reservation at Brothers.  It is a pretty chill bar with lots of televisions. When we stopped by, they had the football game on. It wasn't crowded at all for a Sunday night. We ordered a glass of wine and beer and it was something like $10.50. Pretty decent and cheap for a bar in SF.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Fun little spot!  Drinks are mixed graciously stronger than other bars, and I always enjoy the music.  This plays a mix of everything, and those songs that you rarely here but make you warm and fuzzy inside.

Check the calendar, because they have little events throughout the week.  It is a nice place busy or quiet.
author: Lulu B.

description:
Oh my.  You can really mess yourself up here.  Don't ever drive here.  It's one of those places where they won't cut you off and you might see a fight.  And there's a really good chance of waking up with a stranger.

So when I came home from sea, this is where my friends took me.  And it was everything I said.  We met a bunch of people, took them back to my place, a girl hid in my room, everybody (including her boyfriend) left, I went to bed and Hey!

So there's the possibility of great happenings, but I can easily see things ending badly, too.  And if you're not in the mood to get your toes stepped on and drinks spilled on you, then you should go somewhere nicer.  This place is like a good college party.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
TV's surround you, so you can watch your favorite team. and your friends can watch theirs!

The times I have been here, its been pretty chill. nice bartenders, Clean bar and Clean restrooms! and KILLER Cheap Bloody mary's

Its not my favorite place to watch the game.but, it comes pretty close. I have nothing bad to say.
author: Joy I.

description:
Abbey Tavern for me is synonymous with any professional fighting event.  I'm usually there for boxing events and the UFC, if I'm not watching at some house party.  Its great knowing I can always count on having someplace to watch major fighting events, while throwing back cold beers, and generously poured shots.

WAR BJ "The Prodigy" Penn and Kendall "Spyda" Grove!
JUST SCRAP!
author: Barry A.

description:
My roommate and I are watching Star Wars (episode 3: so bad it's good!) and discussing what rating to give the Abbey Tavern. We feel that it would deserve 5 stars if only it was a bit more crowded. Seriously, it can be sadly deserted, and I don't understand why. The Saturday night DJ spins great music, and I *would* be out there dancing, except that I would also be alone on the dance floor, and I don't have enough confidence or talent for that.

We started our night a couple blocks away on Geary, at the Buckshot Bar. It was packed (the 38 stops right outside the front door, and the bus seems to empty directly into the bar) -- I had to weave through about 30 drunk guys dressed as Santa. The frat boy atmosphere combined with the what-is-he-thinking-DJ drove us out of the Buckshot Bar. That's when we discovered the Abbey Tavern.

Genuine Irish bartenders; nice flat screen TVs; good margaritas (and lemon drops! Sorry -- I am fond of girly drinks); a talented DJ who is a Cal fan; a pool table; all this is well and good. But the 4th star is earned by the clean and spacious women's bathroom! My girlfriends and I decided that we would like to live in the bathroom. However, that may have been because we were fairly tipsy at the time. Good times at the Abbey Tavern!

I would be dangerously close to making this my neighborhood bar if only I lived a bit closer. As it is, I will have to rely on the 38. I will still support it faithfully and I hope you do the same, particularly if you are male, single, straight, smart, cute, etc. Or, at a minimum, if you will help a girl out on the dance floor every now and again, even if all you know how to do is the lawnmower.
author: S R.

description:
We spend an awful lot of time shooting pool at The Abbey Tavern on the corner of 5th Avenue and Geary. I love it because they are capable of pouring my favorite pub drink, a Poor Man's Black Velvet (half cider and half stout) except that they not only have hard apple cider on tap but Wyder's Pear Cider which, when poured with Guinness, makes a great Black Velvet. Kevin loves this place because the pool table is in a remote section of the pub. They also play great music.
 
The downside is the occasional nights where there are drink specials and the place fills up with youngsters just wanting to get drunk and get laid. I'm so over that.
author: Carolyn T.

description:
I've only been there 2 -3 times, but I'll definitely go back because I had a great time.  My friends and I go after work on Fridays (around 7 or 8), so we beat the crowd.  By the time the place starts getting crowded, I'm already drunk so um, I don't really notice the lack of space.  Like at any other meat mark- ...er, bars, ladies are bound to get some unwanted male attention.  I wasn't really bothered by it, and by and large the Irish men friendly and chill.  I've never had to pay for more than 1 of my 9 -10 drinks when I'm there, so that's always a plus because I'm cheap.  

Took one star off because I haven't been there for awhile, and because I've only been there friday nights.  Also, the cash only thing is a bit annoying.  

All in all, a fun time was had by all.  I love guiness (on tap mmm!) and I love Irish men, so it's a win-win situation.
author: Kelly C.

description:
A simple place, so it gets a simple review.
I come here to watch football, so I don't drink alone. The pitchers cost about $14 bucks, and it'll get you three-five beers The TVs are nice, but the projector needs work.  They put the niner game on without being asked, much to the chagrin of the rowdy Irish guys sitting in the corner.  The Irish guys move this bar up from a 3 to a 4 star because they all get super trashed and talk some crazy trash.  If there's no one there on a Thursday night, one of 'em will open up the pool table, and you'll play for free.  The free beef stew and bread they had for the Monday night niner game was super good.
author: Ricky R.

description: I had a lot of fun here. This was one of the bars on my  pub crawl and I had a lot of fun here... maybe because I was reaching the height of my buzz or there happened to be a fun birthday gal there. However, I remember dancing and being very pleased with the bathroom there because there were two stalls (hahaha).
author: Christina B.

description:
Abbey is  a great local, I work a few blocks away and often head there on a Friday for a few beers, there's always nice Friday after-work crowd in there gearing up for the wknd!!!! The barstaff buy you drinks back when they see you've got a few rounds in as well, which is great!

Its a good place to start off in, although a lot of the time, we end up spending the whole night rather than moving on!!! :)

Nice, clean bar, especially after the renovations. Would recommend it to anyone!
author: P M.

description: I wish I could give this place 0 stars. The owner is a JERK. A bartender was serving a friend and I one night and we ordered a shot of the Patron Coffee. I'd never had it, so I asked for it to be served in a rocks glass because I didn't want to shoot it. The bartender didn't understand what I was saying and gave it to us in a shot glass. Whatever; my friend and I sipped on it for awhile. About half way through, the owner comes over out of nowhere and says that he saw us drink it all and since the glass wasn't empty he accused us of reaching OVER the bar and stealing another shot. It was absolutely ludicrous. After that, he wouldn't serve us! Now, if he had seen us do it... ok. If the people next to us had seen us do it, ok. But none of that was the case because we DIDN'T do it. Unbelievable. What a loser! Also the DJ sucks.
author: Audrey K.

description: Your everyday pub. Has a pool table so thats a plus. More men than women like everywhere in SF. And they don't ID here.
author: San F.

description: Oh Abbey, what fun you are. My friend used to live within walking distance. Needless to say those were fun drunken walks home. The bartenders are pretty cool and the drinks are good. Make sure you hit up the ATM because they don't take cards. A good mix of people. Decent music, the DJ's are alright for the most part. A good place to have drinks, talk a bit, then dance once it gets full (and you've gotten your drink on).
author: gabby m.

description: OK place; saw a pretty good Who cover band there one night.  There was a very rude female bartender who pretty much demanded higher tips than what I was giving her for pouring pints.  Not the friendliest vibe in the world. Ireland's 32 down the block is oceans better than this place.  Only go here if there's a good cover band playing or every other place is packed.
author: Mr X.

description: Watched the super bowl here, very good atmosphere.  It got crowded quickly, I was holding to a table for 3hrs for my friends to show, who ended up bailing, but a quartet of cool girls joined me at the table and I made buddies with some guys behind.  All in all I only bought 2 beers that night, everything else was free(as in my new friends were generous). The free food buffet they offered consisted of burgers, chicken drumsticks, and chili, not the best, but you can't complain about free really.  After the game they had a guy playing guitar, who was actually pretty decent, played songs everyone knows.  In terms of the crowd, it might have been because it was the supper bowl, but a lot of Irish guys(not uncommon at an Irish bar) and a fair amount of good looking girl groups.  Anyways I would recommend this place for the next Super Bowl definitely, I'll have to check this place on a different night to see what the crowd is like and send an update.
author: Thomas Crown O.

description: A good place to catch European soccer...much less crowded than the Mad Dog and they charge the same cover charge.  The crowd in the evenings gets a bit rowdy but fun (read: Irish).  Drinks are cheap but they don't take credit cards which is just annoying.  One of the best draft pints of Guinness in town.
author: Geoff K.

description: Same dirty dump it was when I first went there in the early 1980's.  Same type of rude employees as well. Back ink the day, there was usually a group of very rough-looking men seated at the rear of the place. Anyone who came anywhere near them got seriously menacing looks and quickly moved on. Customers told the unwary those goons were active IRA who met there regularly and that the Abbey Tavern was a well-known IRA hangout. I don't know if that was blarney or the truth. Whatever, I still dislike the place and won't go there for any reason.
author: Pam J.

description: The Abbey Tavern must have small carbon footprint , when it comes to electricity anyway, there may be multiple tv's powered up showing the same sporting events, but the cave-live darkness inside definitely offsets that.  The darkness has additional benefits (non-environmental)... good if you are experiencing:  a bad hair day, unsightly blemishes,  orange streakiness from a bad spray tan, a strange rash or perhaps your blacks don't match.  This is the kind of place where beauty is only in the eye of the flashlight holder!
author: Sarah B.

description: Cozy neighborhood bar with pint-sized glasses of Magners cider for $4.50. None of that 12 oz. b.s.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Love the Abbey!! My friends and I love going here especially since us girls have fun dancing to the music while the boys lay back and shoot some pool. They have a full bar which is always a plus and great music by their house DJ or on other nights they have live bands.  Definitely  a great bar & fabulous service!
author: Ashley S.

description: Been going to Abbey for quite some time now and it never fails to deliver a fabulous night out.  A large bar with a huge selection of drinks, pool table, darts, good music, and a lively crowd, doesn't get much better than that! The place was recently renovated and it looks great, especially the bathrooms and you know how bad bar bathrooms can be ladies!  They always show Games, UFC, and on some nights have special bands play. So if your looking for a great spot to have a fun night out get your butt to the abbey and have yourself a pint!
author: Angela T.

description: I try to avoid writing many negative reviews, but I think this one is necessary.  The bartender was incredibly slow and rude.  We came in at around 9 on a Saturday night and there was probably a total of 5 people in the bar.  We waited for 5 minutes or so before he even asked us what we wanted.  When he finally delivered drinks we waited another 5 minutes for him to charge us.  On top of this, he charged me for another person's (more expensive) tab and for mine as well.  For the location and ambiance of this place, the drinks were far too expensive as well.  I won't be coming back.
author: Shawna S.

description: I watched the UFC 60 PPV event over here... Went in and wasn't so packed yet but it did. It's a typical Irish sports bar/pub. 2-3 big screens, 7 TVs, a pool area in the back where you can smoke. The drinks are cheap. Very excited to watch world cup matches next month here.
author: Jose S.

description: I like this place.  I was there on Tuesday night and it was painfully slow, even despite the $1 draft Miller Lites (now I see why Tuesday is probably the slowest night of the week!)  This place has potential to be a great neighborhood bar with a little live music and more peeps.  But truth be told, short of the few spots on Clement, this is a great option for a good draft beer and a great time in the neighborhood.
author: Louis M.

description: I love a good Irish Pub and this wasn't too bad. Definitely more of a club vibe than I'd prefer, but they make a really good Snake Bite.
author: Lindsey G.

description: I like this place alot. The Bartender is nice, and there are many hoes that show up on a good saturday night. IPA on tap, mmm!!
author: Jorge P. G.

description: More than middle of the road 3 stars because this is like the ONLY place except for annoying Jillians that shows PPV boxing fights.  There are at least 4 good size TVs including a big projection type, enough room to move around for a decent view of one or two of them, service at the bar was fast, and the $20 cover not bad/what you'd expect.  It's a run of the mill type Irish divey bar.  Was a good place to watch the fight because,being the only place around for that, everyone is there to do the same.  For this reason alone, which is all this review is based on, it's great.
author: Today Y.

description: I went to the Abbey Tavern on Saturday at about noon to watch the UFC which was being televised live from England. It was a 15 dollar cover charge which is far cheaper then what Jillian charges for the same event (25) and insofar as the drinks at 12 in the afternoon all I had was soda. That was about 2 dollars... They were really cool about allowing the pizzeria next door deliver a pizza to us in the backroom so as far as being accomadating they were awesome. I know its not often that someone is going to be going to Abbey Tavern at noon and perhaps this review isnt very helpful but if you ever find yourself there to watch some kind of an afternoon event its not super packed and the bartender will accomodate pretty much anything. Especially if by anything you mean having a pizza delivered from next door
author: Salvatore R.

description: It is a great place for happy hour during the week.  The lady was very prompt and friendly. I'm sure it is busy on the weekend, but pretty easy hang-out place for Happy Hour.
author: M B.

description: I hate this place.  Cash only, so many drunk, obnixious people.  Just not my cup of tea, at all.  If you want to go to an Irish bar, go to Plough and Stars or Ireland's 32 instead. No need to hit up the "Scabby Abbey"
author: Catherine K.

description: Never been inside, there's usually too many skanky people outside smoking.
author: chris m.

description: Have been coming here, off and on, for too many years to mention...and it's always a good time!  If you want to have the irish bar experience, with some beers and shots and to have a laugh with the local yokes/lads from the Old Country, show up 'round 3pm...that's the vibe, you'll catch the afterwork, blue collar crowd. . If you're more into mixing and minglin', want a broader range of ages/ethnicities, show up 'round 9:30-10:00 when the euro-disco dj starts up!  Like another yelper, I too have tripped up/ down those 3 stairs enroute to the bathrooms/pool room, but that's another story!  And yes, service can be a bit slow, but usually the place is packed and on the loud side after 10, so if you want to sip port in a library, stay home in your "study', Thurston Howell III,  this is fun little spot with lively folks who actually want to have some fun, shake their rumps or whatver and enjoy themselves!  Oh, and watch the threshold when you walk in, most people trip on it and into a crowd of revellers near the front door who seem to enjoy that kinda thing! You'll come across like a regular if you remember to step OVER the threshold, okey dokey?   Enjoy
author: Karen S.

description: Soooo much fun on Weekend nights.  The busiest is Saturdays with a mix of old school hip hop and current top 40 jams for dancing.  The dance floor is small, so it's always crowded.  Unfortunately the bartenders are a little slow and don't take credit cards.
author: Jared F.

description: I used to come here all the time when I first moved to San Francisco and I didn't find myself so much older than the college age crowd here. Came here the other night just for nostalgic purposes and hot damn if it wasn't the same dj, same tunes, same mix of drunken construction workers and USF kids. It was like coming home again. Four stars.
author: Cathy T.

description:
ahhh, the good ol days!

i came to this club because my ex fling took me here.  we had SO MUCH FUN! then afterwards, i came with a friend of mine! i will never forget it...it was so packed and they played guns n roses sweet child of mine! wow, could i scream any louder? that night was awesome!

i came back several times after, it's not the same anymore though, it doesn't get as packed..and the music is not as good...
author: Carolina M.

description: This place looks great since Dermott had the place renovated! Its so clean and the bathrooms are SO clean! This is a great space-they have a pretty cool crowd on Friday nights-they even have $2 Tiger Beer specials on Friday nights. The bartenders are all really cute and so so nice!
author: Dessa R.

description: More like a college bar.  Plays great music.  Drinks are inexpensive.  Small dance floor.  Dart board and pool table.  Crowd/bartenders are great! Need I say more... ?
author: Christi S.

description:
I haven't been here in a looooooong time so I don't know if it's changed much.  I don't suspect that it has based on the recent reviews.  

I stumbled here with my friends after checking out a variety of bars and clubs in one night.  We started at the now-deceased @lpha bar but found it's atmosphere wanting.  Then we headed down to a club-party hosted by Element.  Unfortunately, it was impossible to find parking so we headed back to the richmond and chilled for a bit in Rohan.  Eventually, we moved to Abbey Tavern and had a great time.

The place was packed but we did bring in a few more people.  The music was really good and it does have a club feel which is nice when you want to dance.  All night long, we hit up Irish Car Bombs and danced the night away.

I must admit that it's not easy to find a place that'll do sake bombs or car bombs because they don't want to damage their glassware.  I recommend this place for its drinks and fun atmosphere.  No longer will I wander into crappy clubs.
author: Scott L.

description:
I went here on Monday night to have a drink with an old co-worker. When I started to walk down Geary I did not have a particular bar in mind but I wanted to find someplace I had never been to before; I have been to Ireland 32 (liked it) and a few places on Clement. I looked inside Abbey and became a little hesitant; there were about 10 guys inside and one girl. Now, I like going to bars but sometimes it is boring going alone. I decided to go in anyway; they had about 10 TVs on so there was no way I could get bored while waiting for my friend. I ordered a Stella, grabbed a table and watched the Wisconsin vs. Seattle game on the big screen; I am not super into football but it was entertaining. The Stella tasted a little flat so I decided to make my next one a Guinness. There was a very nice Irish lad at the bar that made me feel right at home with a little pleasant conversation and harmless flirting. It was when I was chatting him up that I noticed soccer on the TV I could not see from my seat; there had been a pole in the way all that time. So, long story short, I sat on the other side of my table and was able to watch soccer, hockey, football and poker all at once; It just does not get any better then that. 

The last wonderful surprise of the evening came on my 3rd trip to the bar, my new friend informs me that they have food for the Monday night football crowd. I thought it would be chips or hot dogs, it was not. They provided a very good beef stew and soft buttered bread, I was impressed.

So, I guess I am saying that I like this bar and the regulars that frequent it. I have not gone on the weekend but I will be back during the week.
author: E P.

description: Back in the spring, my friend was punched in the face ... ON HIS BIRTHDAY! I don't know exactly what went down, but I know my friend is not a shit starter. I see him get sucker punched. Me, along with the 20 or so people we were with, were dumbfounded. The owner and bouncer come forward to put down any potential scuffle, and because the guy was the owner's friend, and "he didn't see anything happen," the guy didn't get kicked out, nor did he left the bouncer throw the guy out. Great way to run your business!
author: Rod M.

description: Ok~ this used to be my "go-to" place to find the lads~ however, it seems to have turned into a hip-hop/gangsta rap dj place on the weekends..so the lads don't seem to flock here the way they used to....good place for daytime drinking however..the brothers that run this place run from surly to sexy to indifferent, decide for yourself who is who.  However, I will always remember the Abbey as the place I met one of my true loves..(.xo GG!)
author: Serena A.

description:
What a craphole, but this was a great place to spend Thirsty Thursdays! Sometimes I miss the days where I can go to a place filled with young people, drink $5 pitchers of Bud and dance until 2am.  I stopped going here on a weekly basis by the time I was 22 and I felt like I was on the higher end of the age spectrum.  If you want a place where everyone is beyond drunk and having a good time.... you've found it.

These days I'd be more likely to take in a fight or a sporting event at The Abbey but I will always remember (maybe not so vividly) my Thursday nights in college that I used to spend at this place. I've been wanting to head back to be a spectator moreso than a participant but I haven't done so yet. Cheers Abbey, thanks for making this a great college party spot!
author: Adam C.

description: This place is definitely a hit or miss. One time I was here on a Friday and it had a pretty good crowd and a DJ spinning some old school and top 40 with everyone getting down. Another Friday I walked in and it was completely empty with some guy that looked like his name could be Cletus performing with his hillbilly band. So if you plan to come here be prepared to have a plan B just in case.
author: Joseph T.

description: They allow a huge group of already half drunk party goers into this place and then hand us half off beer coupons.  I had a great time with my friends and it was my roommates 21st birthday!
author: Jen C.

description: This is the only bar I even attempt to go out to on the weekend sober.  Great mixed crowd with attentive bartenders.  If you're short, 5'2", like I am the boys at the bar are always willing to place your order for you.  The bouncers are great and step in the second someone who should drink has too many.  Every time I go I feel like I'm in the middle of a great house party without all the cleanup.
author: Kris J.

description: a different vibe now than it had a few years ago but still good drinks and a nice time. one weekday night it was full of studly frat boys which was pleasing to us chicks. the next week there were ugly betty's and homely harolds crawling all over. what in the world ? we thought we wandered into a different pub but no, this was still the Abbey. single girlfriend and I decided to have a couple then put an egg in our shoes and beat it. hopefully next time the handsome fellows will be there
author: Prima D.

description:
I've been coming to Abbey's for 1.5yrs every friday almost religiously with my friends. It was cozy for us. We took up the little nook near the dart board, and had fun. So then they decided to go through a remodel...great...
They closed down for a month, and my friends and I were waiting for them to open. Well, opening night, it was crowded, bright, and very unwelcoming. They also no longer have that nook, and whereas before you had some privacy, now there's none. But okay, we gave it another shot yesterday --  a week later -- and were EXTREMELY disappointed. First off, the bouncer is cool, he's a great guy. But that's where the politeness stops. Going up to the bar, I see they have a new guy. I order an AMF for my bf, and instead of going "i don't know what that is" he goes and asks 4 times (and i answer 4 times) "I can't hear you!" So I finally had to tell him what the AMF stand for -- dude got b#!!hurt, and then goes and asks for my ID. I got pissed off at that point and it doesn't help when some stranger is next to me saying I'm underage. Just because I look 18 doesn't mean I am. And the bouncer already checked my ID when we came in. So then I ask for the girl to make my drink (after showing my ID). So he comes up to her, and whispers something in her ear, and then she gets an attitude (which isn't the first time with her). And she won't serve me the drink. She refuses to acknowledge me. 
And you know what, the owner was there and he was rude to our party too. This was horrible. The good bartenders don't work there anymore (one quit and the other doesn't work fridays anymore), and the place just sucks now. From now on, it's Bitter End and Blarney Stone. Abbey is not seeing another penny from me or my group of friends. 
And I don't recommend it because their prices went up quite a bit, and the service sucks at the bar.
author: Katia T.

description: it was nice to find a pub that had really good guiness on tap. sometimes when guiness is on tap it tastes all metallic like or just plain weird. no no this guiness was awesome and perfect for watching the brazil v australia game. relaxed atmosphere and pretty clean, this place could use a freakin air conditioning system. its a little hot in there, and thats even before i started drinking. bar tender was pretty friendly and helpful when i asked if he knew of a brazilian place we could hang out at afterwards. i'd go back.
author: Aly L.

description: What can I say, I love this place! It probably mostly has to do with the fact I met my fiance here but its still cool. I have spent many a nights here, drinking and dancing the night away although I do have to say that the crowd is just not the way it was 2-3 years ago. The past few times we have been here on weekends there has been nobody here....it was kinda weird. I also miss the old "pool/smoking" area even though I am not a smoker. Word is some girl complained and they got fined and had to shut it down or something. Not sure if that is true though.
author: Ashley M.

description: I've been going to the Abbey since I was 18 (eight years) with about a year hiatus until now and I have never been as disappointed as I was tonight. I can understand having hot looking chick bartenders with half a clue, but decent looking bartenders with no clue...unexceptable. The service was the absolute worst and the price for a beverage was just ok. Tell the girls behind the bar to cut back on the jagermeister and learn how to do the job before they get lit on the job!
author: Doug F.

description: no bullshit spot to watch football(proper), boxing and mma. gaa and golf. personally mma isnt my thing, but the atmosphere is grand. im more into watching football live on weekenend mornings or ucl on tues and weds, but that doesnt stop us from having a go at other random times.(fifa tourney in the works for you armchair footballers). from reading the reviews below, it seems as if you give a muggy attitude you'll get one. dont be an ass, and you wont get treated like one. top class.
author: aidan m.

description: went here for the affliction/ufc fights. was $20 to get in, but so was everywhere else because affliction wasnt being shown at many places. the beers were cheap so needless to say, i got hammered. they dont serve food, but they also let you bring in some. so i went to taco bell next door before i walked in. they had plenty of screens to watch both shows. cool, knowledgeable fans were there and made for a great time. plus we were surrounded by the drunk irish regulars who were damn near falling off their stools already. the place kind of turns into a nightclub later on, but i wasnt able to stay for that. next time, im down though!
author: Andrew T.

description:
okay so i'm giving this 4 stars because of all the memories and ridiculousness that happened at the abbey tavern when i was a student at usf. in all honesty, this place is a meat market of nastiness on the busy days (thurs-sat.). total irish spot. if you like drunk, illegal irish men working in construction, this is THE place to find them. you will get hit on and/or groped and quite possibly offered drugs. I'm pretty sure if you like drunk college girls from USF you'll probably find a few there. Trust me, i know, i've been there (amen for that pedro arrupe shuttle) don't be surprised if you walk into the back room where the pool table is and you see a naked stripper. (true story). And don't be surprised if you witness a bar fight or two, three etc. Just make sure you get out of there if you're holding something illegal. The cops love to wait outside the Abbey sometimes. Also, if you like cheesy eurotrash, the weekends give you plenty of that. And hey, if you pretend to be a drunk lesbian you might score a pack of rolos (true story, again)

come here for the football matches, but leave if you're not into the hot sweaty euro trashy scene on the weekends.
author: monica p.

description: I've been here for a few UFC events and am over this place. $15 cover if you're not Irish. Free for the Irish. Sucks for me because I'm not Irish. Those who show up just to hang out, drink and have no interest in watching the fights are screaming over the tv volume making it impossible to hear what I just paid $15 to hear. Some of the smaller tv's have a good/decent picture but are very small. The larger screen in the front has seen better days, and the screen in the back is trash. Brunette bartender is nice, blonde bartender is not so nice. Both are super slow. My buddies and I spend considerable amounts of cash each time we go, and never one drink on the house and not even a good pour. I guess tap beer might be the way to go at this place. Lot's of very drunk people. Some are cool, but others seem to have the run of the place including starting fights and are allowed to stay because they are regulars. Not much personality going on here including from the staff. I'll definitely be looking for a new UFC hangout.
author: Brian C.

description: My friends and I go here one or twice a month, great place.  No creepy locals, the Bartenders know what they are doing, music is pretty good, altho i hate disco nites :P.  Parking sucks.  But its San Francisco,  parking sucks everywhere.  They've got like 6 or 7 TVs, a pool table, and a  dart board.  Pours are always good, i never feel like they are shorting me.  Definitly a good bar to go to with friends.
author: Mike S.

description: This place is awesome - newly remodeled, great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and excellent service/drinks.  Perfect for any night of the week - after work, happy hour, or on the weekends.  Great for watching sports - or large groups.  I have only been there a couple times, but excited to bring some of my girlfriends & co-workers back with me!
author: Eileen H.

description: my best advice: go on an off night. when it's crowded this place is waayyy packed and sweaty and there is no chance in hell you'll get the bartender's attention. last time i came here i ended up taking shots from a flask and saw people with 40s. looks like i wasn't the only one who gave up on the bartender. +1 star because once we ffiiinally got his attention he gave my roomie a free pitcher for being patient. so we chugged it and went to bitter end.
author: N. M.
